scenario:
Charles Schwab had an excellent first quarter with significant revenue and earnings growth. Key financial highlights include:

- Revenue of $5.6 billion, an 18% year-over-year increase, beating estimates of $5.5 billion.
- Net income of $1.9 billion, a 40% year-over-year increase.
- Earnings of 99 cents per share, a 46% year-over-year increase, and adjusted earnings of $1.04 per share, beating estimates of $1.01 per share.

Trading revenue rose 11% to $908 million due to higher trading volumes, while asset management and administration fees increased 14% to $1.5 billion. The firm added $138 billion in new assets, a 44% year-over-year increase, with $59 billion in new assets in March alone.

Key metrics include:

- 8% increase in new brokerage account openings to 1.2 million, bringing the total to 37 million active accounts.
- 9% increase in total client assets to $9.93 trillion.
- 24% increase in money market fund assets to $621.5 billion, generating $418 million in revenue.
- 22% increase in stock and bond funds assets to $658 billion, generating $122 million in revenue.
- 15% increase in inflows into managed investing solutions to about $711 billion, generating $569 million in revenue.

The firm raised its dividend by 8% to 27 cents per share, with a yield of 1.43%. Analysts have set a median price target of $88 per share, suggesting 14% growth.
